internship_program.title: W4C INTERNSHIP PROGRAM (WIP)
internship_program.subtitle: Waste4Change's Biannual Internsip Program
internship_program.message:
Participate in a special internship program from Waste4Change along with other participants from various field of expertise

Internships can be done either remotely or through direct contact according to your needs. Internship opportunities are open in all of Waste4Change's branches, be it in Bekasi, Semarang, and Sidoarjo

From researching about the hottest topics on environmental and waste issues to practicing public speaking, Waste4Change ensures that your internship will be rich with various experiences

items.title: At least a Final Year college/vocational student when the internship period started
Submit necessary documents such as CV, Motivation letter, and portfolios if the candidate is applying for positions relating to design
Work/research/organizational experience and/or proof of participation in seminar/workshops relating to the field the candidates are applying for will become an added value
Willing to work according to the required internship period
Have a personal laptop for working

I learned a lot of skills, especially one relating to business and waste management, which was exciting since I have not learned about it before. faq.title: Frequently-Asked Questions (FAQ)
faq.subtitle: Have some questions regarding the recruitment process? Check out our F.A.Q

items.question: How long is the internship period at Waste4Change?
items.answer: For Waste4Change Internship Program (WIP), the required internship period is 4 months, and both the start and end date has been set

items.question: How many interns does Waste4Change accommodate each year?
items.answer: It varies according to the needs. To give an example, Waste4Change accepts almost 35 interns for each batch in 2020.

items.question: I have submit my intern application documents, but I have not received any update/reply. Does that mean my application was not successful?
items.answer: Applicants who passed the first selection phase will be contacted to do an online/offline interview. If the candidates have not been contacted 1 month after the documents submission or after the internship has been closed, then your resume and portfolios will be considered for other vacancies in the future that might suit your qualifications.

items.question: I have passed the documents selection and have done the interview, but I have not been contacted. Does that mean I was not selected?
items.answer: Applicants who passed the second selection phase (interview) will be contacted to do further discussion regarding the preparation to start the internship. If the candidates have not been contacted 1 month after the interview date, then your resume and portfolios will be considered for other vacancies that might suit your qualifications.

items.question: Can I apply to other companies when I am undergoing the internship selection phase at Waste4Change?
items.answer:
Yes, certainly you can. Waste4Change believes that the internship selection phase should be a two-way process, meaning that Waste4Change will be selecting your documents and qualifications, and you can also select Waste4Change credibility as your internship destination.
To ease the process, please do not forget to inform your needs and expectations for the internship program that you will undergo at Waste4Change via the Motivation Letter or during the interview process.

items.question: What should I include in the Motivation Letter?
items.answer:
Below are some of the things that you can write down in the motivation letter:
  1. Why are you interested in joining the internship program at Waste4Change?
  2. Your workshop/seminars/organizational/work experience that are in line with the field that you are applying for
  3. Some special notes that the interviewees need to know, for instance:
    1. Applying internship as a compulsory course from the university
    2. Applying internship for research purposes
    3. rying to explore new field that is different with the existing educational background/college major
Write at least 2 paragraphs using a professional language, the point is that the letter should give an overview of what makes you different from the other candidates.

items.question: Can I send my application in hardcopy using postal service?
items.answer:
Yes you can, but we strongly suggest to use the digital method instead to avoid using excessive papers and eliminate the risk of losing your application documents in the delivery process.
If you want to apply for other internship vacancies outside the Waste4Change Internship Program (WIP), please send your Motivation Letter, CV, and portfolios (if any) to recruitment@waste4change.com with the subject: Name_Position You're Applying For.
For the hard copy documents, you can send it to the following address:
  1. Human Capital Division
  2. Waste4Change (PT Wasteforchange Alam Indonesia)
  3. Kantor SUB, Vida Bumi Alam Hijau, Jl. Alun Alun Utara, RT.002/RW.001, Padurenan, Mustika Jaya, Bekasi City, West Java 17156
  4. Telp: 021-29372308

items.question: Is there a minimum age for the internship program at Waste4Change?
items.answer: Kindly check the internship requirements that we have included at the website

items.question: Does Waste4Change offer transport and accommodation fees for interns?
items.answer: Waste4Change provides allowance and transportation fees for interns. The detail of the nominal can be further discussed during the interview, after the candidates passed the first selection phase.

items.question: Will I get a certificate as a token of internship from Waste4Change?
items.answer: Waste4Change will issue a certificate of participation for the participants of the WIP. If there are other needs regarding the certificate, please discuss the matter during the interview process, after the candidate have passed the first selection phase
